name: Timeline Photos
caption:
#CSharp Feature I would love â€” Dynamic Types w/ Interfaces

Today I realized I wanted a feature in C#, but it was not there...

http://bit.ly/1qQ0OVD

data.message:
That'd be awesome **IF** it made it into C#.
It'd be like adding TypeScript into my C# language. Add support for read-only properties in interfaces and then you get a very nice way to implement Value Types in Domain Driven Design!
Check the github repo referenced at the end
In this example, the type was not meant to be an ExpandoObject exactly. Dynamic here referred to the resolution of the properties, not the C# `dynamic` features.

Admittedly, the feature can be a small enhancement in situations where you see similarities in code you consume but you don't have control over the creator of the code. It can be used wrong easily (I actually had a long chat with co-workers on how this feature can be bad as well).

yeah the Repo is about true dynamic typing (the DLR), but his example isn't.
The feature he's asking for is simpler and easier to make and it wont affect readability that much.
Java actually has that feature, it's called anonymous interface implementation (I think), like how most people use ActionListener, but in Java it looks ugly and is overly used due to the lack of delegates in Java :S
I talked to someone who understands this Java and Obj-C stuff, and he suggested that dynamic classes might be close (Java) and Open Protocols (Obj-C).
